page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: BOZEAT IS SITUATED ON THE A509 SEVEN MILES SOUTH OF WELLINGBOROUGH AND TWELVE MILES EAST OF NORTHAMPTON . THERE IS A GREAT DEAL OF TRAFFIC PASSING THROUGH THE VILLAGE ON THE WAY TO THE M.1. AND THE NEW CITY OF MILTON KEYNES.IT IS MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK AS "BOSIETE". BOZEAT IS AN ANCIENT VILLAGE GOING BACK AT LEAST TO SAXON TIMES AND PROBABLY BEFORE THAT.SAXON COINS AND A SAXON PRE-CHRISTIAN BURIAL AREA HAVE BEEN FOUND HERE.THE NAME "BOZEAT" HAS BEEN CONNECTED WITH THE "TOWN WELL" AND IS SAID TO BE NORMAN-FRENCH FOR "BEAUTIFUL"(BO),"SPRING"(JET). ANOTHER EXPLANATION IS GIVEN AS "BOSSA'S GATE"-BOSSA BEING A LOCAL SAXON.
